intro: Zephyranthes stellatorosea, commonly known as the star-flowered rain lily, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in wet, shaded environments such as marshes and along riverbanks. It has strap-like, narrow leaves that are usually evergreen, and it produces small, round berries that contain the seeds. Zephyranthes stellatorosea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and its ability to thrive in humid conditions.
